definition: thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)
lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc
dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]

sentences.english: Low-voltage dual frequency synthesizer for radio telephones.
sentences.chinese: 低电压无线电话双频率合成器。

sentences.english: Wireless phones are, by far, more common than landlines.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止无线电话用户比固话用户更多。

sentences.english: She tripped over a cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 她被无线电话的线给绊倒在地。

sentences.english: She radiotelephoned her mother to say she would be late.
sentences.chinese: 她给母亲打无线电话说她要晚到。

sentences.english: The function of mobile phones and pagers should be set to vibration.
sentences.chinese: 无线电话及传呼机功能必须设置为振动。

sentences.english: The invention relates to a method of providing authentication in a radiotelephone network.
sentences.chinese: 本发明涉及到提供无线电话网中的鉴别方法。

sentences.english: Cutting-edge designs incorporated in this mobile phone have made it extremely user-friendly.
sentences.chinese: 这无线电话内置的多项创先设计，使其极为方便易用。

sentences.english: I was visiting a friend who could not find her cordless phone.
sentences.chinese: 我正拜望一位朋友时，她找不到自己无线电话。

sentences.english: Time Division Multiple Access a digital wireless telephony transmission technique.
sentences.chinese: 一种数字无线电话传道输送技术。
